briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: With this constructor, Create() should be called in order to create the button bar.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=0)
memberdef.name: wxRibbonButtonBar

briefdescription.para: Construct a ribbon button bar with the given parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Parent window for the button bar (typically a wxRibbonPanel).
An identifier for the button bar. wxID_ANY is taken to mean a default.
Initial position of the button bar.
Initial size of the button bar.
Button bar style, currently unused.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (wxWindow *parent, wxWindowID id=wxID_ANY, const wxPoint &pos=wxDefaultPosition, const wxSize &size=wxDefaultSize, long style=0)
memberdef.name: Create

briefdescription.para: Create a button bar in two-step button bar construction.

detaileddescription.para: Should only be called when the default constructor is used, and arguments have the same meaning as in the full constructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (int button_id, const wxString &label, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL)

briefdescription.para: Add a button to the button bar (simple version).

memberdef.argsstring: (int button_id, const wxString &label, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString)

briefdescription.para: Add a hybrid button to the button bar (simple version).

memberdef.argsstring: (int button_id, const wxString &label, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString)
memberdef.name: AddToggleButton

briefdescription.para: Add a toggle button to the button bar (simple version).

memberdef.argsstring: (int button_id, const wxString &label, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxBitmap &bitmap_small=wxNullBitmap, const wxBitmap &bitmap_disabled=wxNullBitmap, const wxBitmap &bitmap_small_disabled=wxNullBitmap, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL, const wxString &help_string=wxEmptyString)
memberdef.name: AddButton

briefdescription.para: Add a button to the button bar.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the new button (used for event callbacks).
Label of the new button.
Large bitmap of the new button. Must be the same size as all other large bitmaps used on the button bar.
Small bitmap of the new button. If left as null, then a small bitmap will be automatically generated. Must be the same size as all other small bitmaps used on the button bar.
Large bitmap of the new button when it is disabled. If left as null, then a bitmap will be automatically generated from bitmap.
Small bitmap of the new button when it is disabled. If left as null, then a bitmap will be automatically generated from bitmap_small.
The kind of button to add.
The UI help string to associate with the new button.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer which can be used only with other button bar methods.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int button_id, const wxString &label, const wxBitmap &bitmap, const wxString &help_string, wxRibbonButtonKind kind=wxRIBBON_BUTTON_NORMAL)

memberdef.name: InsertButton

briefdescription.para: Insert a button to the button bar at the given position.

parameterdescription.para: Position of the new button in the button bar.
ID of the new button (used for event callbacks).
Label of the new button.
Large bitmap of the new button. Must be the same size as all other large bitmaps used on the button bar.
Small bitmap of the new button. If left as null, then a small bitmap will be automatically generated. Must be the same size as all other small bitmaps used on the button bar.
Large bitmap of the new button when it is disabled. If left as null, then a bitmap will be automatically generated from bitmap.
Small bitmap of the new button when it is disabled. If left as null, then a bitmap will be automatically generated from bitmap_small.
The kind of button to add.
The UI help string to associate with the new button.

simplesect.para: An opaque pointer which can be used only with other button bar methods.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of buttons in this button bar.
Set the client object associated with a button.

detaileddescription.para: The button bar owns the given object and takes care of its deletion. Please, note that you cannot use both client object and client data.

briefdescription.para: Get the client object associated with a button.
Set the client data associated with a button.

detaileddescription.para: Please, note that you cannot use both client object and client data.

briefdescription.para: Get the client data associated with a button.
Returns the N-th button of the bar.
Returns the first button having a given id or NULL if none matches.
Returns the id of a button.
Calculate button layouts and positions.

detaileddescription.para: Must be called after buttons are added to the button bar, as otherwise the newly added buttons will not be displayed. In normal situations, it will be called automatically when wxRibbonBar::Realize() is called.

briefdescription.para: Delete all buttons from the button bar.
Delete a single button from the button bar.
Enable or disable a single button on the bar.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the button to enable or disable.
true to enable the button, false to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Set a toggle button to the checked or unchecked state.

parameterdescription.para: ID of the toggle button to manipulate.
true to set the button to the toggled/pressed/checked state, false to set it to the untoggled/unpressed/unchecked state.

briefdescription.para: Returns the active item of the button bar or NULL if there is none.

detaileddescription.para: The active button is the one being clicked.

briefdescription.para: Returns the hovered item of the button bar or NULL if there is none.

detaileddescription.para: The hovered button is the one the mouse is over.

briefdescription.para: Indicates whether tooltips are shown for disabled buttons.

detaileddescription.para: By default they are not shown.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether tooltips should be shown for disabled buttons or not.

detaileddescription.para: You may wish to show it to explain why a button is disabled or what it normally does when enabled.

briefdescription.para: A ribbon button bar is similar to a traditional toolbar.

detaileddescription.para:
It contains one or more buttons (button bar buttons, not wxButtons), each of which has a label and an icon. It differs from a wxRibbonToolBar in several ways:
Individual buttons can grow and contract.
Buttons have labels as well as bitmaps.
Bitmaps are typically larger (at least 32x32 pixels) on a button bar compared to a tool bar (which typically has 16x15).
There is no grouping of buttons on a button bar
A button bar typically has a border around each individual button, whereas a tool bar typically has a border around each group of buttons.
Events emitted by this class
The following event handler macros redirect the events to member function handlers 'func' with prototypes like: voidhandlerFuncName(wxRibbonButtonBarEvent&event)

Event macros for events emitted by this class:
EVT_RIBBONBUTTONBAR_CLICKED(id, func): Triggered when the normal (non-dropdown) region of a button on the button bar is clicked.
EVT_RIBBONBUTTONBAR_DROPDOWN_CLICKED(id, func): Triggered when the dropdown region of a button on the button bar is clicked. wxRibbonButtonBarEvent::PopupMenu() should be called by the event handler if it wants to display a popup menu (which is what most dropdown buttons should be doing).
Library:wxRibbon <>< =''>:</>&;&;< =''>\ </></>
